reviews.title: One of the best ones
reviews.text: This is conveniently located in the centre and close to railway station and little far from railway station...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Prince is nothing to write home about but it is a reasonable three star hotel. It appears to be the best option in Bhuj and with a good modest restaurant opposite it is an attractive choice under all the circumstances. The modern facade hides a shabbier building behind. The staff are amiable if dozy. We thought they were unused to dealing with Western tourists and seemed to be more responsive to the imperious demands of some of the domestic tourists. Our suite was reasonably comfortable and quiet. We didn't manage to succeed in getting the lights fixed or one of the aircon units functioning in the few days we were there.
reviews.title: comfortable but no great shakes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Familty friend Dr Rana recommended this hotel. It caters to International business and leisure travellars. Must go to both Restutants and ask staff on how to enjoy Gujarati Thali for ($ 4). Staff will arrage for car and driver. Ask for Osman, he very good driver and can get you guide etc Make a request and service staff will go above and beyond to meet your needs. We spent one extra day in this part just because of the Hotel.
reviews.title: Wow, it makes you feel like Maharaja

reviews.text: Restaurants were the best in BHUJ.. Jesal & Toral.tayed in a fantastic super delux room that was reasonable priced and had good food.
reviews.title: Ranotsav

reviews.text: Good place to stay if you are visiting Bhuj. Stayed in a fantastic super delux room that was reasonable priced and had good food.
reviews.title: Welcome break

reviews.text: I have been staying at this hotel for the past (at least) ten years. Although not luxury it is friendly, comfortable and relatively clean. Has a kind of Faulty Towers charm! Good veg and non veg food in the dining room. Service is a bit slow but hey who is in a hurry in Bhuj? Could do with decent Internet facility and fridges in all rooms but is slowly undergoing these changes. Overall good value for money. I take my tour groups there when we are doing the Bhuj type things as it suits most tastes. To date the best place to stay in Bhuj for slightly upmarket travelers. Excellent shop sells local embroidery products and a nightly book seller has some surprising finds.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I stayed there for few nights.
reviews.title: not great but no so much choice in Bhuj

reviews.text: When I arrived, I was shocked to see the dirty mat and towel in my room. The room was quite dusty and I needed to ask them to clean again. The toilet and shower were not so great. But we could have hot shower. I do not think this hotel worth for money.
reviews.title: visiting

reviews.text: You should check a couple of rooms before you check-in. Each room has different size and quality for the same price.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: The restaurant was fine. I ate both two restaurants. The famous thali restaurant was fine, but it was not something so special, as I have had better thaili before. My favorite thali is agashiye in Amhmedabad(around 500rupees). But bhuj thali was much cheaper.(around 150rupees)
reviews.title: surprisingly pleasant stay

reviews.text: Only good thing about the hotel was manager. He helped me a lot for booking hotel and taxi. He was really nice and friendly.( elder man was also nice)
reviews.title: Not up to scratch even for India
Good local gujarati cuisine
reviews.text: Food is good and cost effective.

reviews.title: best location
reviews.text: very good location as shopping area was just there and loved the food there too .
There was lots of restuarant nearby and walking distance to shopping area.
reviews.title: Loved the Service
